title: Aïn Taïba
text:
'Aïn Taïba (or Hassi Taïba) is an <a href="oasis">oasis</a> and <a href="pit%20cave">pit cave</a> in Algeria.
Location.
Aïn Taïba is about south of <a href="Ouargla">Ouargla</a> and about north of <a href="Bordj%20Omar%20Driss">Bordj Omar Driss</a>, in the middle of the desert.
It is above sea level. 
It is a water hole with a perimeter of about .
History.
Aïn Taïba was known to nineteenth-century explorers as the only water point in the <a href="Issaouane%20Erg">Issaouane Erg</a> (Grande Erg Orientale) dune massif.
It was therefore a necessary stopping place. 
Among others the oasis was visited by <a href="Fernand%20Foureau">Fernand Foureau</a>, Ismaël Bou Derba, <a href="Paul%20Flatters">Paul Flatters</a> and <a href="Gaston%20M%C3%A9ry%20%28explorer%29">Gaston Méry</a>.
